Term.Name: Linear with non-sync
Term.Definition: Linear programme with non-syncronised, non av content. Example: DTT Wimbledon

Term.Name: Linear with sync
Term.Definition: Linear programme with syncronised non av content. Example: Weakest Link Dsat Quiz, TV Nav bar

Term.Name: Multi stream audio
Term.Definition: Multi, parallel stream linear audio programme. Example: Parallel audio radio drama

Term.Name: Multi stream video
Term.Definition: Multi, parallel stream linear audio/video programme. Example: Interactive Wimbledon, Walking with Beasts

Term.Name: Non-linear multi stream
Term.Definition: Non-linear multi, parallel stream video programme

Term.Name: Hybrid NVOD
Term.Definition: Hybrid NVOD - locally stored material linking back to scheduled AV content. Example: Viewer can choose a movie off a PDR immediately (it has been pre-cached), watch and then they will be linked seamlessly back into a 'live' looped channel at an appropriate point

Term.Name: Mix and match
Term.Definition: Video with audio programme (component) Ids eg: BBC1 video with BBC2 audio

Term.Name: Parallel 'layer controlled' audio or video support
Term.Definition: Multiple decoders allow dynamic mixing of audio or video

Term.Name: Linear broadcast with online insertions
Term.Definition: Linear broadcast programme with dynamically inserted online content. Example: Inserted ads into broadcast content, alternate tangents against broadcast content
